title: Starbucks introduces coconut milk to its lattes in the UK - but Twitter hates the 'garbage' drink
title_page: Starbucks introduces coconut milk to its lattes in the UK - but Twitter hates the 'garbage' drink | Daily Mail Online
text:
After a successful trial run in the US, Starbucks has introduced introduction of coconut milk lattes to its UK menus.
But the coffee chain's decision to include the plant-based milk alternative has been met with derision from those on Twitter, who have been flooding social media with their negative feedback.
Many said the drink was 'garbage' and 'not nice', and claimed to instantly regret purchasing it.
After a successful trial run in the US, Starbucks has introduced introduction of coconut milk lattes to the UK
Prad Patel tweeted: 'Work colleague orders a Starbucks Coconut Milk Latte out of intrigue. He now knows what regret tastes like.'
Echoing the regret was Rosie, who wrote: 'Ordered a Starbucks coconut milk latte. Filled with regret from the first sip. Just in case you were thinking of ordering one.'
Another customer, Bill Dann, agreed, posting:' Just had a coconut milk latte in Starbucks to see what it tasted like - absolutely disgusting, threw most of it away.
Some Twitterati took it upon themselves to warn others. Akesha Reid wrote: 'GUYS. The coconut milk latte from Starbucks is NOT NICE' and accompanied her message with 'disgusted' emoticons.
Cooper Vuna was also unhappy with his drink, writing: 'Just tried a coconut milk latte at Starbucks. Disappointing,'
One woman was so unhappy with the drink that she claimed the chain's coconut milk was 'garbage' and posted a picture of the ingredients used to make the drink.
Twitter user Socal Mom slammed Starbucks for the drink, calling it 'garbage' rather than coconut milk
But despite the negative feedback, there were a few who were full of praise for the drink.
Ally wrote: 'I am so excited about the coconut milk latte at Starbucks.'
Jo Yo claimed to be so happy with the new offering that they were unsure as to how to react, writing: 'Starbucks has coconut milk now and idk [I don't know] what to do with my life.'
William Paris said he tried a mocha dink with coconut milk. He posted: 'Had one last week at a mocha. Tastes like a little bit of paradise.'
Starbucks started testing coconut milk in stores in US last year as an alternative to dairy products.
The coffee chain is not testing almond milk, a popular non-dairy option, at this time due to the 'critically important safety of our customers with nut allergies,' a spokesperson said.
They continued: 'We're pleased to offer our customers another non-dairy milk alternative and we've received some very positive feedback on our Coconut Milk Latte.
